data.heading: AC Gas
data.description: Basically, Refrigerant gases are used to cool or heat certain areas of cooling or heating systems., such as air conditioners or freezers. Ammonia and carbon dioxide are the most widely used natural refrigerants due to their excellent thermodynamic properties. On the other hand, fluorocarbon-based refrigerants are synthetic substances, which began to be developed and produced in the 1930s. Many types of Gases are available in the Market - The most widely used zeotropic mixtures today are the following: R-R134, 404A, R-410A, R-407A, In all of them, the slip produced by the different boiling and condensation points of the substances that make up each mixture is taken into account. Applications: Refrigeration and Air Condtioning
